intro: Dodecatheon meadia var. brevifolium, commonly known as the short-leaved eastern fringetop, is a variant of the eastern fringetop, a member of the Primulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States, typically found in moist, wooded areas. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, with a distinctive fringed appearance. Its leaves are shorter and more compact compared to the typical variety, giving it a unique appearance. This variant is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
